description.other_contributors: Derek Corrigan, Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland, Ireland
description.other_details: Lung volumes [Internet]. [date unknown];[cited 2010 Aug 25 ] Available from: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lung_volumes Spirometry [Internet]. [date unknown];[cited 2010 Aug 25 ] Available from: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spirometry Johns DP, Pierce R. Pocket guide to spirometry. McGraw-Hill Medical; 2007. Pingul EM, de Guia TS, Ayuyao FG. FEV1/FEV6 VS FEV1/FVC IN THE SPIROMETRIC DIAGNOSIS OF AIRWAYS OBSTRUCTION AMONG ASIANS. In: Chest Meeting Abstracts. 2007 p. 491c. Tiffeneau R, Pinelli A. Air circulant et air captif dans l'exploration de la fonction ventilatrice pulmonaire. Paris Med 1947;133:624-8.

details.purpose: To record results of pulmonary function tests, including spirometry and lung volume testing.
details.use: Used to record all representations of pulmonary function testing, including spirometry. Multiple events and state information may be used to capture pre and post bronchial challenge or bronchodilation results.
details.misuse: Supporting subject information, often required to interpret the tests, such as smoking status or oxygenation, should be captured in separate, specific archetypes.

details.purpose: Izmeriti rezultate testov pljučnih fukcij, vključno s spirometrijo in testi pljučnih volumnov.
details.use: Uporablja se za zapis vseh meritev funkiconalnih zmogljivosti pljuč, vključno s spirometrijo. Uporabljenih je lahko več dogodkov in podatkov o stanju za opis pre in post bronhialnega testa ali rezultatov bronhodilatacije.
details.misuse: Informacije, ki služijo kot podpora pri odločitvah in so pogoste pri tovrstnih testiranjih (npr. kadilski status ali oksieganacija krvi) naj se zajamejo v ločenih, specifičnih arhetipih.

items.items: Pulmonary function testing including spirometry and other lung volume testing.
The time taken to complete a forced expiration.
The volume of the conducting airways.
Details of the device used to measure pulmonary function.
Shows volume (liters) along the Y-axis and time (seconds) along the X-axis.
Graphically depicts the rate of airflow on the Y-axis and the total volume inspired or expired on the X-axis
Also called carbon monoxide diffusing capacity test .

In North America the unit for D, co is mL CO/min/mm Hg. The Systeme Internationale unit is mmol/min/kPa, and in Europe the test is called the CO transfer factor. The following equation converts between the 2 units: D, 2.986 X T
The maximum capacity of an individual's body to transport and utilize oxygen during incremental exercise.
The ratio of actual to predicted test result.
The agent or physical modality used e.g exercise.
The dose of agent used in the test.
The bronchodilating agent used in the test.
Pulmonary function test that returns a measured volume or caclulated capacity.
A pulmonary function test result expressed as a ratio.
Pulmonary function test that returns a measured flow rate.
The amount of air that can be forced out of the lungs after a maximal inspiration. Emphasis on completeness of expiration. Also termed expiratory vital capacity (EVC) Calculated= IRV+ Vt+ ERV
The volume change of the lung between a full inspiration to total lung capacity and a maximal expiration to residual volume.
The volume of gas contained in the lung after a full inhalation.
The amount of air that can be forcibly blown out in one second.
The amount of air that can be forcibly blown out in three seconds.
The amount of air that can be forcibly blown out in six seconds.
The amount of air that can be forcibly blown out in 0.75 of a second.
The maximum flow generated during expiration performed with maximal force and started after a full inspiration. Also termed Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR).
The average flow of air from the lung during the middle portion (25-75%) of expiration (also sometimes referred to as the MMEF, for maximal mid-expiratory flow).
The average flow of air from the lung during the middle portion (25-50%) of expiration (also sometimes referred to as the MMEF, for maximal mid-expiratory flow).
The average flow of air into the lung during the middle portion (25-75%) of inspiration.
The average flow of air into the lung during the middle portion (25-50%) of inspiration.
The maximal volume that can be inspired following a normal expiration. Also termed Inspiratory vital capacity (IVC). Calculated = TV+IRV
The amount of additional air that can be pushed out after the end expiratory level of normal breathing.
The additional air that can be inhaled after a normal tidal breath in.
A measure of the maximum amount of air that can be inhaled and exhaled in one minute. Also termed Maximum ventilation per minute
The ratio of Forced Expiratory volume in 1 second to Inspired vital capacity. Calculated = FEV1/ IVC.
The ration of Forced expiratory volume in 1 second to Forced vital capacity.
The volume of air inspired and then expired from the lung during one respiratory cycle.
The amount of air left in the lungs after a maximal exhalation.
The amount of air left in the lungs after a tidal breath out. Calculated = ERV+RV.
The name of the pulmonary volume test/parameter.
The name of the pulmonary flow rate test.
The nameof the pulmonary ratio test.
The timin of the event in
Details of the agent used in the test.
The test was taken before the challenge.
The test was performed after the bronchial challenge.
The timing of the test in relation to the challenge.
Comment on and record other incidental factors that may affect interpretation of the observation.
Textual or coded interpretations of the test results.
Patient related reason for failure of test.
Instrument related reason for failure of test result.
Volume displacement spirometer shows a leak detected.
Rip or tear detected in flowhead connector tube for flow spirometers.
Patient took additional breath during expiration.
Patient did not perform expiration for sufficient duration.
Mouthpiece of measuring equipment obstructed by tongue or teeth.
Patient stopped or started expiration during manoeuvre.
Patient stopped expiration on instructions from clinician.
The patients posture was too poor to achieve a reliable result.
The body position of the subject at the time of measurement.
Standing at the time of measurement.
Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of measurement.
Reclining at the time of measurement.
Lying flat at the time of measurement.
The ratio of actual to predicted test result.
The patient is too young to perform the test.
The subject is physically unable to perform the test.
Testi pljučnih funkcij vključno s spirometrijo in ostalimi testiranji pljučnih volumnov.
Podrobnosti naprave uporabljene pri testiranju pljučnih fukcij.
Prikazuje volumen (litri) vzdolž Y-osi in čas (sekunde) vzdolž X-osi.
Grafični prikaz stopnje pretoka zraka na Y-osi in totalnega volumna vdihanega in izdihanega zraka na X-osi.
Poimenovan tudi test difuzijske kapacitete ogljikovega monoksida.

*In North America the unit for D, co is mL CO/min/mm Hg. The Systeme Internationale unit is mmol/min/kPa, and in Europe the test is called the CO transfer factor. The following equation converts between the 2 units: D, 2.986 X T(en)
Maksimalna kapaciteta posameznikovega telesa za transport in porabo kisika pri večstopenjskem obremnitvenem testu.
Razmerje izmerjenih vrednosti glede na predvidene.
Testi pljučnih fukcij, rezultat katerih je izmerjen volumen ali razmerje.
Rezultati pljučnega testiranja prikazani v razmerjih.
Merjenje največjega pretoka zraka pri ustih
Količina zraka izdihana po maksimalnem vdihu. Poudarek je na popolnem izdihu. Imenovano tudi ekspiratorna vitalna kapaciteta (EVC) Izračunano = IRV+ Vt+ ERV
*The volume change of the lung between a full inspiration to total lung capacity and a maximal expiration to residual volume.(en)
Volumen zraka v pljučih po popolnem vdihu.
Forsirani izdihani volumen v prvi sekundi (FEV1)
Volumen zraka, ki ga človek po maksimalnem izdihu z manevrom forsiranega izdihovanja izdihne v eni sekundi.
Volumen zraka, ki ga človek po maksimalnem izdihu z manevrom forsiranega izdihovanja izdihne v treh sekundah.
Volumen zraka, ki ga človek po maksimalnem izdihu z manevrom forsiranega izdihovanja izdihne v šestih sekundah.
Volumen zraka, ki ga človek po maksimalnem izdihu z manevrom forsiranega izdihovanja izdihne v 0.75 sekunde.
*The maximum flow generated during expiration performed with maximal force and started after a full inspiration. Also termed Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR).(en)
*The average flow of air from the lung during the middle portion (25-75%) of expiration (also sometimes referred to as the MMEF, for maximal mid-expiratory flow).(en)
*The average flow of air from the lung during the middle portion (25-50%) of expiration (also sometimes referred to as the MMEF, for maximal mid-expiratory flow).(en)
*The average flow of air into the lung during the middle portion (25-75%) of inspiration.(en)
*The average flow of air into the lung during the middle portion (25-50%) of inspiration.(en)
Največji volumen vdihanega zraka po normalnem izdihu. Imenovana tudi inspiratorna vitalna kapaciteta (IVC). Izračunana = TV+IRV
Količina dodatnega zraka, ki se izdiha po običjanem izdihu.
Količina zraka, ki se lahko vdihne po običajnem vdihu.
*A measure of the maximum amount of air that can be inhaled and exhaled in one minute. Also termed Maximum ventilation per minute(en)
Razmerje med FEV1 (forsiran ekspiratorni volumen v eni sekundi) in SVC (inspiracijska vitalna kapaciteta). Izračunano = FEV1/ IVC.
Razmerje med FEV1 (forsiran ekspiratorni volumen v 1 sekundi) in FVC (forsirana vitalna kapaciteta).
Količina vdihanega in izdihanega zraka tekom enega dihalnega cikla.
Količina zraka, ki ostane v pljučih po maksimalnem izdihu.
Količina zraka v pljučih po običajenm izdihut. Izračunano = ERV+RV.
Podrobnosti o uporabljenem sredstvu v testu.
Test je bil opravljen pred izzivom.
Test je bil opravljen po bronhialnem izzivu.
Čas testa v primerjavi z izzivom.
Opis in komentar ostalih dejavnikov, ki bi lahko vplivali na interpretacijo pregleda.
Tekstovna ali s kodami označena interpretacija rezultatov testov.
Kalibracijski test ni bil zadovoljivo opravljen zaradi napake naprave.
Bolnik je med izdihom dodatno vdihnil.
Bolnik ni dovolj časa izvajal izdihovanja.
Blokada ustnika merilne napravez jezikom ali zobmi.
Bolnik je med manevrom ustavil ali na novo začel izdih.
Bolnik je končal izdih zaradi navodil zdravstvenega osebja.
Bolnikova telesna drža je bila preslaba za dosego relevantnih rezultatov.
Sedi (npr. na postelji ali stolu) v času meritve.
Leži na ravnem v času meritve.
Razmerje izmerjenega PEFa glede na predvideni PEF
Bolnik je premlad za opravljanje testa.
Bolnik je fizično nezmožen opraviti test.
